intro: Eriosema scioanum, commonly known as the nightshade eriosema, is a herbaceous plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowering period occurs during the summer months, and it is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Eriosema scioanum is notable for its ecological role in supporting local insect populations.
